citation.article-title: Roseomonas aestuarii sp. nov., a bacteriochlorophyll-a containing alphaproteobacterium isolated from an estuarine habitat of India

p.s: Description of Roseomonas aestuarii sp. nov.
Roseomonas aestuarii (aes.tu.a' rii. L. gen. n. aestuarii of the estuary, the habitat from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are coccobacilli (0.6–1.0 μm width, 1.5–2.0 μm length), Gram-negative, non-spore forming and non-motile.
Colonies are orange colored, circular, pulvinate, smooth, mucoid and glistening with an entire margin on tryptone soya agar (3 days, 30 °C).
Obligate aerobe.
Optimal growth occurs at pH 7.0 (range 7–8) and 30 °C (range 20–40 °C).
NaCl is not required for growth but is tolerated up to 1.0%.
The in vivo absorption spectrum of intact cells in sucrose exhibits maxima at 452 and 974 nm.
Pigments extracted in acetone:methanol have absorption maxima at 371, 495, 608 and 768 nm.
Bacteriochlorophyll-a and carotenoids of the spirilloxanthin series are present.
Gelatin, starch and urea are not hydrolyzed.
Positive catalase reaction and non-hemolytic.
Indole is produced from l-tryptophan.
Chemo-organoheterotrophy is the only growth mode.
Good growth is obtained on d-glucose, d-fructose, sucrose, peptone, pyruvate, succinate, butyrate, glycerol, butanol and mannitol.
Growth on citrate, acetate, propionate, formate, valerate, caprylate, malate, fumarate, benzoate, tartarate, glutamate, aspartate, methanol and ethanol is not possible.
No vitamin requirement.
The fatty acids (>1.0%) comprised C18:1ω7c, C16:1ω7c/iso-C15:02OH, C16:0, C16:0 3-OH, C18:12OH, C16:1ω5c, and C19:0 cycloω8c.
Resistant to ampicillin, penicillin and streptomycin but susceptible to kanamycin, chloramphenicol and tetracycline.
The type strain JC17T (=CCUG 57456T=KCTC 22692T=NBRC105654T) was isolated from estuarine tidal waters in Tamil Nadu, India.
The DNA G+C (by HPLC) content of the type strain JC17T is 66.2 mol% (additional strain JC19a is 66.6 mol%).
